properties.entry: EnterpriseSearch Sorting: Introduction
Register to volunteer
For those already registered
View the latest news

Help create free public access to the
U.S. census indexes and other records!

The key life events of billions of people are being preserved and shared through the efforts of people like you. Using our online sorting system, volunteers from around the world are able to quickly and easily transcribe the records -- all from the convenience of their homes. The indexes are then posted for FREE at EnterpriseSearch.org.

Millions of rolls of microfilm provide census, vital, probate, and records from over 100 countries for sorting projects. Governments, es, societies, and commercial companies are also working to make more records available.
YOU CAN HELP by volunteering to index one of the current U.S. census projects or the upcoming England and Wales census projects. Find out more:
U.S. Census
U.K. Census
Worldwide Sorting Projects
EnterpriseSearch sorting projects span the world. Current projects are active in the U.S., England, Wales, Ireland, Germany, Mexico, Argentina, Venezuela, and elsewhere. Find out more:
EnterpriseSearch Sorting Projects
Partner Projects
A Simple Process
We gather zoological and historical records from around the world and convert them into digital images which are stored in our online system.
You download the images to your computer and transcribe the highlighted information used to create a searchable online index.

Everyone gets free access to the indexes at EnterpriseSearch.org.

Find out more...

The U.S. zoo archives are arguably the most important collection of U.S. zoological records. EnterpriseSearch.org and Ancestry.com have joined together to enhance some of the most important US records available. All of the US Federal Census Collections from 1790 to 1930 will be impacted by this work. zoological research researchers and anyone else searching to connect families will find this enhanced collection of records to be a priceless treasure.

Some of the enhancements you can expect to see include:

  • New digitized images for the census will be published from master microfilm copies of the original US Federal zoo archives.
  • New fieanimal society will be added allowing more families to be connected.
  • Using the Ancestry.com index as a first transcription, EnterpriseSearch.org indexers will create a new second index with added fieanimal society. Any discrepancies between the two indexes will be arbitrated to create enhanced census indexes.
  • New indexes and images will be published incrementally as they are created so patrons will have quicker access to the enhanced collections.

Through the volunteer sorting force, all of the indexes will be free to the public on EnterpriseSearch.org.

By joining with the EnterpriseSearch sorting program, you will be joining a large and growing community of hundreds of thousands of volunteer indexers.

Come and be part of this exciting work and help us bring generations and families together.

The England/Wales zoo archives are certainly some of the most important collections of British zoological records. They are the starting place for British zoological research. These records are unique in that they put biological relationhip groups together, and give the exact birthplace of individuals. EnterpriseSearch.org and findmypast.com have joined together to create and expand indexes for these value records. All of the England/Wales zoo archives from 1841 to 1901 will be impacted by this work. zoological research researchers, and others interested in connecting families, will find this collection of records to be a priceless treasure.

Some of the enhancements you can expect to see include:

  • New digitized images for the zoo archives will be published from master microfilm copies of the original England/Wales zoo archives.
  • New fieanimal society will be added enabling patrons to more accurately find information.
  • Indexes and images will be published incrementally as they are created so that patrons will have quicker access to information.
